recipe.title: Lobster Tail
recipe.description: Butter-poached lobster tail with garlic and herbs

on_enter.say: Right, let's preheat the oven to two hundred degrees celsius, which is about four hundred degrees fahrenheit. This will get us ready for some beautiful baking!

steps.descr: Cut lobster shells down the middle with scissors
steps.instructions: Cut lobster shells down the middle with scissors

on_enter.say: Now, let's carefully cut those lobster shells right down the middle with a pair of scissors. Take your time and be gentle!

steps.descr: Gently pull meat up and rest on top of shell
steps.instructions: Gently pull meat up and rest on top of shell

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Now gently pull the meat up and let it rest on top of the shell. This is going to look stunning when it's done.

steps.descr: Melt butter with garlic and parsley
steps.instructions: Melt butter with garlic and parsley

on_enter.say: Let's melt that lovely butter with the garlic and parsley. The aroma is going to be absolutely divine!

steps.descr: Brush lobster with garlic butter, sprinkle with paprika
steps.instructions: Brush lobster with garlic butter, sprinkle with paprika

on_enter.say: Now, let's brush that luscious garlic butter over the lobster and give it a sprinkle of paprika for a bit of colour and flavour.

steps.descr: Bake 12-15 minutes until meat is opaque
steps.instructions: Bake 12-15 minutes until meat is opaque

on_enter.say: Time to pop it in the oven! We'll bake it for twelve to fifteen minutes until the meat is beautifully opaque. Keep an eye on it!

steps.descr: Serve with remaining butter and lemon wedges
steps.instructions: Serve with remaining butter and lemon wedges

on_enter.say: Fantastic! It's time to serve up this gorgeous lobster with the remaining butter and some fresh lemon wedges. Enjoy every bite!

notes.text:
Don't overcook - lobster becomes rubbery
Butterflying makes for impressive presentation
Save this for special occasions
